name: Whirled Copper Fire
description:
A fire whirl starts as a circular gust of wind rising in heat and turbulence and then forms into 
eddies of air that can suck in all types of debris and combustible gases. 

Some of that debris can contain elements, like copper, tungsten, etc… depending on what elements may be in the fire, and the temperature of the fire itself, the fire burns different colours from all across the emission spectrum.

A person’s life journey can be just as whirlish, a chaotic voyage that can attract and repel all sorts of elements, all which shape our personalities, all which can be associated with a colour - depending on our moods, our emotions, our daily experiences.

Continuing with my experiments with animation effects, this time I used a ripple glitch on a pixelated and colourful burned base.
